name: Isaac Julien

roles_in_work.title: Un Chant d'amour. Flames of passion. Looking for Langston (X)

biography: Isaac Julien was born in 1960 in London, United Kingdom, where he currently lives and works. On graduating from St Martin's School of Art in 1984, Julien founded Sankofa Film and Video Collective, and was a founder member of Normal Films in 1999. Julien was nominated for the Turner Prize in 2001 for The Long Road to Mazatl√°n (1999), made in collaboration with Javier de Frutos and Vagabondia (2000), choreographed by Javier de Frutos. Earlier works include Frantz Fanon: Black Skin, White Mask (1996), the Cannes prize-winning Young Soul Rebels (1991) and the documentary Looking for Langston (1989). Isaac Julien has been a visiting lecturer at Harvard University and the Whitney Museum of American Arts' Independent Study Programme. He is research fellow at Goldsmiths University of London. In 2001 Julien was the recipient of the MIT Eugene McDermott Award in the Arts. In 2003 Baltimore won the Grand Jury Prize at the Kunstfilm Biennale, Cologne.
